data.title: Putnam Hall, Fountain & Bjornson Obelisk
data.meta_description: Description: The Carnegie Library and fountain. The Carnegie Library was built by a grant from the Carnegie Foundation for $15,000 and $3,400. The cornerstone for the library was laid on June 7, 1905 and the NDAC Carnegie Library was officially dedicated on January 18, 1906. When a new library was built (1949-1950), the music department took over the building and in 1952 it was rededicated Putnam Hall, in honor of long time music professor and leader of the Gold Star Band, Dr. Clarence “Doc” Putnam. Today, Putnam Hall houses temporary offices. In the background is the Bjornson Obelisk. On Tuesday morning, May 17 1904, the Bjornson 'bautasten [obelisk], which had been placed on the North Dakota Agricultural College grounds, near Old Main, was unveiled. This Obelisk is in honor of Bjornstjerne Bjornson (1832-1910), the great Norwegian writer and statesman, who won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1903. The buildings of NDAC were all decorated with bunting and the flags of Norway and the United States. A large crowd, estimated from three to five thousand, was on the grounds. The granite sculpture is 13 feet tall and weighs 4 tons. Date of Original: 1908 Item Number: Bolley 34.3 Ordering Information: library.ndsu.edu/archives/collections-institute/photograp...
data.text:
Description: The Carnegie Library and fountain. The Carnegie Library was built by a grant from the Carnegie Foundation for $15,000 and $3,400. The cornerstone for the library was laid on June 7, 1905 and the NDAC Carnegie Library was officially dedicated on January 18, 1906. When a new library was built (1949-1950), the music department took over the building and in 1952 it was rededicated Putnam Hall, in honor of long time music professor and leader of the Gold Star Band, Dr. Clarence “Doc” Putnam. Today, Putnam Hall houses temporary offices.

In the background is the Bjornson Obelisk. On Tuesday morning, May 17 1904, the Bjornson 'bautasten [obelisk], which had been placed on the North Dakota Agricultural College grounds, near Old Main, was unveiled. This Obelisk is in honor of Bjornstjerne Bjornson (1832-1910), the great Norwegian writer and statesman, who won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1903. The buildings of NDAC were all decorated with bunting and the flags of Norway and the United States. A large crowd, estimated from three to five thousand, was on the grounds. The granite sculpture is 13 feet tall and weighs 4 tons.

Date of Original: 1908

Item Number: Bolley 34.3

Ordering Information: library.ndsu.edu/archives/collections-institute/photograp...
